page.title: 19Employment, Stallingborough
page.content: Stallingborough is now basically a dormitory village, with the majority of workers employed in the Humber Bank Industries. The British Rail depot at Immingham employs a few train drivers and guards.There are a few self-employed people: a plumber, builder, joiner and market gardener. Only ten men are employed on the two farms. The few professional people are mainly teachers and nurses, with two doctors. Unemployment is fairly high- around 15%. In the past few years local factories have cut their work force by offering early retirement or redundancy to employee over 55. Womens jobs tend to be in factory offices and part-time in shops, supermarkets and frozen-food factories. Very few apprenticeships are available for school leavers and some 16 year olds join youth training schemes.
